e4: Adopting the new policy of unbiased earnings reporting aligns ABC with ethical norms, establishing greater investor trust and potentially mitigating risks of legal challenges or penalties. e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, truthful, and free from intentional bias or manipulation. It should adhere to legal and regulatory standards, ensuring accurate representation of the company's financial health. Additionally, it must consider the impact on all stakeholders, promoting fairness and preventing any group, particularly less sophisticated investors, from being disadvantaged. Clear communication and adaptability to changing standards or expectations also reflect ethical considerations, building trust and integrity in financial reporting.
e6: Questions: How will management plan to communicate the transition to a new unbiased reporting policy to investors effectively? What specific measures are in place to support retail investors' understanding? Are there any additional preparations needed to ensure compliance and minimize potential surprise-related stock performances among coinvest thereto.fore?
